dublinCore.dc:title: 115 HR 5538 IH: To amend title 38, United States Code, to provide for the inclusion of certain additional periods of active duty service for purposes of suspending charges to veterans’ entitlement to educational assistance under the laws administered by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs during periods of suspended participation in vocational rehabilitation programs.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Peters (for himself, Mr. Bergman, Mr. Walz, Mr. O'Rourke, Ms. Brownley of California, Mr. Poliquin, Ms. Kuster of New Hampshire, and Mr. Palazzo) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Veterans' Affairs

form.official-title: To amend title 38, United States Code, to provide for the inclusion of certain additional periods of active duty service for purposes of suspending charges to veterans’ entitlement to educational assistance under the laws administered by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs during periods of suspended participation in vocational rehabilitation programs.

section.header: Inclusion of certain additional periods of active duty service for purposes of suspension of charges to entitlement during periods of suspended participation in Department of Veterans Affairs vocational rehabilitation programs
section.text: Section 3105(e)(2) of title 38, United States Code, is amended by striking or 12304 and inserting 12304, 12304a, or 12304b.
